The space race is entering a new era of exploration, in which the number of robotic and human missions to various places in our solar system is rapidly increasing . Lab-on-a-chip nanobiosensors appear to be an emerging technology capable of revolutionizing space exploration, given their low footprint, high accuracy and low payload requirements .

The study of extremophiles and extremely hostile locations can answer many questions from the field of evolutionary biology to molecular biology and industrial biology for space exploration . LoC nanobiosensors are ideal for applications in all major sectors related to space and remote environments exploration .

Microfluidic technology has gained particular interest in the field of LoC systems development, mostly due to its low manufacturing costs . Researchers have explored the possibility of using microfluidsic systems in planetary science . Microfluids provide a straightforward assay method widely used for efficient analyte detection . LoC devices have the smallest footprint of any analytical alternative .

The investigation of microbial pathogenesis and infection processes in space could help preserve astronaut health . The use of nanobiosensors is rapidly spreading in diagnostics and in the biochip industry .

The exploitation of extreme environments as planetary analogs could help explain the relationship between life, environments, and humans, in order to better design technical strategies for deep space exploration . An experimental approach of particular interest in space microbiology is rock biomining and/or bioleaching, namely the processes of extracting metals from low-grade ores and wastes .
